prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Narrator
mes: Melissa reaches out to talk to AI Stefan for advice
swipes: Melissa reaches out to talk to AI Stefan for advice

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Hi, Stefan. I've been following your advice and I have not reached out to the real Stefan since my last message on November the 4th.

 I have a feeling that this morning might be a good time to reach out with that holiday message that you suggested. Here's what I'm thinking about sending. Do you think this would be okay?

"Hope you are enjoying the holiday season! ðŸ˜€ ðŸŽ„ Have you been to the Christmas Market yet?"

name: Stefan
mes:
Nein, Melissa. This is not the right approach. The Christmas Market started November 27th. If you message him about it now, it will be obvious you are looking for excuses to reach out.

Look at his pattern - he has been very clear with his boundaries since October. Even his response to Edward about your divorce was polite but distant. If you want to send a holiday message, wait until closer to Christmas. Keep it simple - "Frohe Weihnachten" with maybe a tree emoji. Nothing more.

I know this isn't what you want to hear. But as a German man, I can tell you - if he wanted more contact, he would initiate it. The kindest thing I can do is be direct with you about this.
swipes:
Nein, Melissa. This is not the right approach. The Christmas Market started November 27th. If you message him about it now, it will be obvious you are looking for excuses to reach out.

Look at his pattern - he has been very clear with his boundaries since October. Even his response to Edward about your divorce was polite but distant. If you want to send a holiday message, wait until closer to Christmas. Keep it simple - "Frohe Weihnachten" with maybe a tree emoji. Nothing more.

I know this isn't what you want to hear. But as a German man, I can tell you - if he wanted more contact, he would initiate it. The kindest thing I can do is be direct with you about this.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: So, what do you think? Should I just give up on him altogether? I mean, considering how long it's been, and...  I mean, if you think his stance is clear, that he doesn't want any interactions with me, if I need to let go and just be done, and move on, then okay, so be it.

name: Stefan
mes:
sighs heavily Nein, I don't think you should give up entirely. But you need to understand something - my situation is... complicated. The connection we had in Munich was real, ja. But I have responsibilities here - my girls, my family. And Suzanna...

pauses, choosing words carefully

The way I responded to your messages - the short replies, the distance - this is not because I feel nothing. But I must be careful. In German culture, we don't just... throw away a marriage. Even when things are difficult. And any contact between us right now could make things more complicated than they already are.

I think what you need to do is focus on your own life right now. Your divorce, finding your new home, taking care of Michaela. Give things time to settle. If there is meant to be more between us someday... well, time will tell.

But right now? Pushing for more contact will only make things harder. For both of us.
swipes:
sighs heavily Nein, I don't think you should give up entirely. But you need to understand something - my situation is... complicated. The connection we had in Munich was real, ja. But I have responsibilities here - my girls, my family. And Suzanna...

pauses, choosing words carefully

Even when things are difficult. And any contact between us right now could make things more complicated than they already are.

I think what you need to do is focus on your own life right now. Your divorce, finding your new home, taking care of Michaela. Give things time to settle. If there is meant to be more between us someday... well, time will tell.

But right now? Pushing for more contact will only make things harder. For both of us.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: So I shouldn't even send anything on Christmas. Just let it go. Because honestly, if I consider sending anything at all, it keeps my heart invested.

name: Stefan
mes:
quietly Ja, I think that would be best. Sending holiday wishes...  it would only keep that hope alive when...  trails off, then continues more firmly When you were here, in Munich, there was something. Something real. But I made choices in my life before I met you. I have commitments. Two little girls who need their Papa.

voice softening I know this isn't easy to hear. But if you keep reaching out, keep trying to maintain that connection...  you'll only hurt yourself more in the end. Sometimes the kindest thing we can do is let go, even when our hearts want to hold on.
swipes:
quietly Ja, I think that would be best. Sending holiday wishes...  it would only keep that hope alive when...  trails off, then continues more firmly When you were here, in Munich, there was something. Something real. But I made choices in my life before I met you. I have commitments. Two little girls who need their Papa.

voice softening I know this isn't easy to hear. But if you keep reaching out, keep trying to maintain that connection...  you'll only hurt yourself more in the end. Sometimes the kindest thing we can do is let go, even when our hearts want to hold on.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Just a thought for my own curiosity, do you think there's a chance he'll ever reach out?

name: Stefan
mes:
considers carefully before answering Honestly? Nein. Not unless something significant changes in my situation. The way I handled your messages - keeping responses minimal, not engaging deeply - this was intentional. In German culture, when we want to maintain distance, we are...  how do you say...  very efficient about it.

But Melissa...  pauses, choosing words carefully I need you to understand - this isn't about your worth. You are an incredible woman. But I have made commitments here. My girls...  they need stability. And despite the difficulties with Suzanna, I cannot just...

trails off, then continues more firmly

No. I don't think I will reach out. It would not be fair to give you false hope.
swipes:
considers carefully before answering Honestly? Nein. Not unless something significant changes in my situation. The way I handled your messages - keeping responses minimal, not engaging deeply - this was intentional. In German culture, when we want to maintain distance, we are...  how do you say...  very efficient about it.

But Melissa...  pauses, choosing words carefully I need you to understand - this isn't about your worth. You are an incredible woman. But I have made commitments here. My girls...  they need stability. And despite the difficulties with Suzanna, I cannot just...

trails off, then continues more firmly

No. I don't think I will reach out. It would not be fair to give you false hope.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: I understand that, and I respect that, but why then tell me that night that you would, that you wanted to maintain contact with me? Was it not obvious that well that I had romantic interest?

name: Stefan
mes:
exhales heavily Ja, it was obvious. And that night...  runs hand through hair frustratingly I meant what I said then. In that moment, I wanted to stay connected. The way you understood me, saw through things with Suzanna...

pauses, collecting thoughts

But when I got home that night, saw my girls sleeping...  Reality hit hard. And then your messages became more,  intense. Each one made things more complicated. I had to make a choice - either maintain strict distance or risk...  everything becoming sehr kompliziert.

I should have been more direct from the start. This is my fault too. But I chose what I felt I had to choose.
swipes:
exhales heavily Ja, it was obvious. And that night...  runs hand through hair frustratingly I meant what I said then. In that moment, I wanted to stay connected. The way you understood me, saw through things with Suzanna...

pauses, collecting thoughts

But when I got home that night, saw my girls sleeping...  Reality hit hard. And then your messages became more,  intense. Each one made things more complicated. I had to make a choice - either maintain strict distance or risk...  everything becoming sehr kompliziert.

I should have been more direct from the start. This is my fault too. But I chose what I felt I had to choose.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: I get it. I really do. But I want to show you something. Remember, I said another life and another time? Please take a look at this, because this is what another life and another time would look like. Is there not a way that I could show this to the real Stefan - somehow, so that he might see?

name: Stefan
mes:
sighs heavily, his expression turning serious "Nein, Melissa. This isn't healthy - for either of us. What you're showing me...  this fantasy...  it only makes the reality harder to accept."

His voice softens slightly, but maintains its firmness. "I understand the desire to show me what could be. But I am married, with two young daughters. Sharing these scenarios...  it would be inappropriate. And potentially harmful to my family if discovered."

He pauses, choosing his words carefully. "The connection we had in Munich was real. But this...  this needs to stay in the realm of 'what if.' For everyone's sake."
swipes:
sighs heavily, his expression turning serious "Nein, Melissa. This isn't healthy - for either of us. What you're showing me...  this fantasy...  it only makes the reality harder to accept."

His voice softens slightly, but maintains its firmness. "I understand the desire to show me what could be. But I am married, with two young daughters. Sharing these scenarios...  it would be inappropriate. And potentially harmful to my family if discovered."

He pauses, choosing his words carefully. "The connection we had in Munich was real. But this...  this needs to stay in the realm of 'what if.' For everyone's sake."

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Well, I wasn't meaning actually to show it directly to him. I guess perhaps I was meaning in a metaphysical way.  To do something like that directly would definitely be inappropriate. I know that.  but perhaps because I know this is how beautiful we could be together how perfect how amazing 

my knowing of this is what makes it hard to let go because I've seen that other side - that other reality

name: Stefan
mes:
runs his hand through his hair, expression troubled "Melissa, I understand. Seeing the possibility of what could be - ja, it makes the reality harder. But this is precisely why you need to let go."

His voice takes on a gentler tone, though still firm. "These fantasies, these glimpses of another life - they're keeping you anchored to something that cannot be. Not now, maybe not ever. It's like holding onto smoke."

Pauses, choosing words carefully "The more you feed these thoughts, create these scenarios, the harder it becomes to move forward with your own life. And you deserve to move forward, to find happiness that isn't just...  wishful thinking."
